Title: Series: Imperiale e reale Galleria di Firenze
Description: Sacred allegory: in the foreground a terrace with on the left the Virgin enthroned and flanked by two other women; at centre, Christ Child sits on a cushion and holds an apple; behind him two children pick the fruits from an apple tree; on the right, Job and St Sebastian look on; St Peter leans on the fence surrounding the terrace while nearby St Paul walks with a sword in his hand; beyond, a landscape, with on the right a centaur looking at St Anthony Abbot walking down some stairs; after a painting formerly attributed to Giorgione, now to Giovanni Bellini. c.1841/46 Etching
Curator's comments: For comment on series see 1857,0411.25. After the painting in the Galleria degli Uffizi, Florence.
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
